task_summary: The robot locates and pulls open the oven door using an arm, verifying success.

task_long_description.overview: This episode captures a robot arm opening a toy oven door in a kitchen mockup. The arm uses visual perception to locate the oven door, aligns for actuation, pulls the door open along its handle axis, and verifies the final open state. Scene objects include the oven (with a swing-down door), gripper, and background kitchen items; the robot must avoid collisions and ensure sufficient opening.
preconditions: Robot is positioned in front of the oven
Robot arm and gripper are unobstructed
stepwise_plan: Check if oven door is visible; scan if not.
Approach and align with the oven door/handle.
Pull the oven door open by 0.10m perpendicular to oven front.
success_criteria: Oven door is visibly and physically open
failure_and_recovery: If oven door not detected, re-scan up to 3 times.
If approach misaligns, task aborts with error.
If pull is obstructed, recovery not attempted in this BT.
task_long_description.termination: Behavior tree completes when oven door is verified open or upon irrecoverable failure.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Visually scans for the oven door if not immediately visible.
Refine perception and pose estimation of oven door.
Approaches and makes fine alignment with the oven door for manipulation.
Pulls the oven door open 0.10 meters perpendicular to the oven front.
Checks whether the oven door is now open.

failure_modes: Oven door not detected in field-of-view after retries
Approach or alignment fails (e.g., collision or occlusion)
Door does not register 'open' after pull
recovery_strategy: Retry scanning for oven door visibility up to 3 times
Abort upon approach/alignment or pull failures
assumptions: Instruction requests opening the oven door; this matches visual evidence.
Exact handle pose is inferred from frames (no direct grasp in action set).
The frames suggest a vertical pull (direction_deg=90).
No explicit force/tolerance constraints in instruction; default bins used.
Contact sheet frames show opening action (no conflict).

expected_success_criteria: Oven door visibly in open state (as in frame_6)
Robot does not drop or collide during execution
